Job Description:
Customer Focus
- Assist with provision of invoice, credit control whilst maintaining good customer relations.
- Be able to handle complaints, problem solving based on professional manner.
- Be able to manage customer’s expectation.
- Assist with development of a high performance service culture within the functional area.
Strategic Perspective 
- Comply with the intent of policies, procedures and agreements.
- Assist in identifying and maintaining succession plans for all key finance positions.
Leadership
-  Play a supervisory role through job delegation and succession plan.
-  Build others’ trust in own professionalism, integrity, expertise and ability to get results.
Planning and Execution
- Assist with developing checklist for review and type of documentation required for accounting purpose.
Regular work
Monitor account receivables
- Ensure that all timely invoicing to customers/related parties and relevant recordings are accurate and supported by necessary documentation.
- Ensure that bank accounts and other balance sheet items reconciliations are performed on a monthly basis. Explanation is provided for any big ticket items.
- Conduct credit checks on all customer, establish and manage limits
- Weekly reporting of invoicing totals/aging totals/cash receipts/invoice adjustments
- Reconcile A/R sub-ledger to general ledger
- Check daily cash collection reports and bank-in slips.
- Report on the daily cash and bank balance positions to management.
- Conduct the regularly monitoring and check at the store level for domestic retailed sales.
Other activities:
Fixed Assets
- Maintain and update the fixed asset list.
- Reconcile fixed asset subsidiary ledgers to the GL monthly and resolve any resulting discrepancy discovered.
- Tag existing and new assets.
- Conduct fixed asset counting (asset verification).
- Assist in safeguarding the assets.
- Prepare monthly fluctuation analyses on changes in the FA and accumulated depreciation accounts and communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Taxation
- Prepare monthly tax return and other document attached with the return.
- Assist in lodgment the monthly tax return.
- Assist in make tax payment
- Maintain and file all the relevant documents and correspondence from tax department.
Job Requirement:
State the minimum knowledge, experience, skills, specialization and other requirements for competent performance of this job taking into account the following factors: COMMITMENT, ADAPTABILITY, TEAMWORK, AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE.
- Degree in Finance/Accounting or equivalent.
- Professional accountancy qualification (CPA, CA or equivalent) (preferable)
-  2 - 3 years experience in a similar capacity as Account Receivable role.
- English communication skills, spoken & written.
- Analytical skills.
Company Profile: KFG is a group of companies specialized in rice process & export, agro-industry, healthcare, and entertainment. KFG is a leading rice exporter and processor in Cambodia and is currently having two subsidiaries: Noyakong Group and Puzzles Club. Our office is located in Phnom Penh city.

Job Description:
Under the direct supervision of the Finance Director, the Accounts Manager manages all the Company's accounting function by conducting reviews, verifying and reconciling all related accounting records; ensures that all accounting transactions are posted in the system correctly and completely and appropriately classified and recognized as per the accounting policies of the Company; ensures that all financial reports are furnished to the management on a timely manner & accurately; assists in budget preparation and financial projection; ensures that all internal control procedure and policies of the Company are complied with and that they are working effectively; develops good working environment and promotes high performance of staff under Accounts Division.
Customer Focus 
- Provide professional services for invoicing, credit control and debt collection whilst maintaining good customer relations.  
- Build effective relationships to enhance the company’s business and statutory reputation within the local legal framework.  
- Build relationship with external auditors and regulatory authorities. 
- Liaise with others divisions to ensure that documentation submitted relating to accounts are adequate and that they are on time. 
- Provide technical support on investment and financial analysis.  
Strategic Perspective 
- Assist FINANCE DIRECTOR in process improvements aligning with corporate strategies. 
- Assist FINANCE DIRECTOR in identifying and maintaining succession plans for all key finance positions. 
- Provide financial input as required. 
Leadership 
- Assist with development of KPIs with team members and monitor individual performance. 
- Assist with the allocation of appropriate resources and commitment of staff to the achievement of company objectives and targets. 
- Assist with identification of training needs and opportunities to develop a highly skilled functional department. 
Planning and Execution 
- Assist with designing of budget and cash flow projection template. 
- Assist with developing checklist for review and type of documentation required for accounting purpose. 
- Ensure that adequate financial policy framework is in place to guide financial decision-making by the top management (i.e. MD and FINANCE DIRECTOR). 
- Work closely with the Leadership Team (Operations Director and others department heads) as part of a mutually supportive, advising them on the likely financial consequences of all proposed courses of actions. 
- Participate in key strategic development for the Company. Assist FINANCE DIRECTOR in preparing annual budget and forecasts aligned to strategic plans. 
- Prepare required detailed reports on financial matters. 
- Maintain contact and liaise with investors/lenders/bankers, main customers/suppliers and auditors to ensure the long term financial security and stability of the Company. 
- Implement financial controls in order to obtain accurate and complete financial information.  
- Produce accurate financial reports to specific deadlines and interpret those reports. 
- Ensure the monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements comply with local and international accounting standards. 
- Manage a company's financial accounting, monitoring and reporting systems. 
- Research and report on factors influencing financial performance. 
- Conduct reviews and evaluations for cost-reduction opportunities. 
- Ensure the finance processes comply with company standards and, where there are deviations, these are adequately substantiated. 
- Ensure the approved policies and procedures are fully and correctly implemented and in compliance with company risk management procedures and appropriate coverage for local risks. 
- Work closely with other departments to do the forecast and predict future trends.
Job Requirement:
- State the minimum knowledge, experience, skills, specialization and other requirements for competent performance of this job taking into account the following factors:      COMMITMENT, ADAPTABILITY, TEAMWORK, and AND ENGLISH LANGUAGE. 
- Degree in Finance/Accounting or equivalent.
- Professional accountancy qualification (CPA, CA or equivalent) (preferable).
- 3 - 5 years experience in a similar capacity as Accounting Manager.
- English communication skills, spoken & written.
- Software skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
- Analytical skills.

KFG is a leading rice exporter and processor in Cambodia and is currently having two subsidiaries: Noyakong Group and Puzzles Club. Our office is located in Phnom Penh city.

Job Description:
Deputy Project Director
The Song Saa Foundation is devoted to promoting the health and wellbeing of the marine, land and human environment of the Koh Rong Archipelago, in southwest Cambodia.
The Foundation is seeking a Khmer national to run its community engagement, environmental education and other village-based programmes. Based on Koh Rong island, the manager will also provide support to the Project Director and to other staff of the organisation and their programmes. 
Other requirements include:
•	Academic and professional background in environment and environment management (including minimum of a bachelors degree in a relevant field). 
•	At least three years experience working in the environment or community engagement field.
•	Excellent Khmer and English speaking and writing ability.
•	Proficiency in Word, XL and other Office programmes. 
•	Ability to work alongside others to achieve sustainable outcomes.
The Foundation is offering an excellent salary and benefits package for the correct candidate. Applicants should send a covering letter and CV to Wayne McCallum, wayne@songsaa.com . Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Job Description:
•Determine scope of review in conjunction with the Chief Audit Executive
•Establish risk-based audit programs
•Prepare checklist/internal control questionnaires (ICQ) for each assignment
•Conduct risk assessment of assigned company or functional area based on audit schedule. 
• Review the adequacy and effectiveness of internal control systems of function audited  
•Conduct audit testing of specified area and identify reportable issues and dimension of risk 
•Know how to communicate at your level during entrance and exit meetings with auditees and communicate within the department effectively.
•Prepare audit work papers; write findings and comprehensive report to the Chief Audit Executive. 
•Other duties assigned as needed
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or ACCA preferred, but MBA in accounting or finance from accredited university is a plus. 
•Attended internal audit training
•Strong analytical, written/verbal communication, interpersonal, and relationship building skills 
•Fluent in English and Khmer
•Ability to adapt to change quickly and multi-task. 
•Understand people behavior
•junior role: 1 to 2 in internal auditing experiences. 
•Senior role: 3 to 5 years in internal auditing experiences.

Company Profile:
The Apple International School is a renowned school located in Poi Pet near the border of Thailand. Due to our expansive programs and reputation for excellence, we have surpassed all expectations locally in education and find ourselves growing at a tremendous pace. 

We offer students with top-notch facilities, excellent qualified English and Khmer teachers, high quality uniforms, British and American English curriculum, pronunciation classes and more! 

Our school provides children with not only a hot meal for lunch; however, we assist with nap time at our Kindergarten location and provide a swimming pool, breakfast facility and more at our General Education Program facility. 

It is our honor to uphold The Kingdom of Cambodian Moral Code and we strive to provide excellent education to all students including our Teacher Assistants. 

As we grow, we expect our staff will grow with us and we are progressing as one of the top employers in Poi Pet. 

Charity is a big part of our mission and we firmly believe in giving back to the Cambodian people by helping those in need such as giving pencils to villages in need, donating funds for local hospitals and more.

Our client is one of the leading international company specialized in insurance and financial consultant. The Insurance Specialist will station at the bank that the company operates with in order to provide insurance sales services to the bank customer/staffs.

MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


• Provide sufficient financial advice to potential clients through professional manner base on demand analysis an fact finding
• Constantly identify qualified prospects to introduce insurance provided
• Collaborate proactively with all stakeholders to achieved expected results
• Deliver excellent customer services to clients
• Ensure accuracy and compliance of all request completed on time and fit to quality standards set by the company
• Perform and assist other tasks as much as required
Job Requirement:
REQUIREMENTS


• Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing or relavent Fields
• Very good level of English and communication skill
• Successful background in cusotmer service/sales or any other related field, experience in insurance is a plus ( Fresh potential graduates are welcome)
• Strong network
• Ability to work with people from diverse background
• Ability to learn and adapt to new business environment
• Ability to be flexible and solution-oriented
• Willing to travel
Company Profile: We are professionals in HR and MANAGEMENT CONSULTING based in Cambodia and engaged across South East Asia. We maximise the EFFICIENCY and the PRODUCTIVITY of YOUR ORGANIZATION.

Company Profile:
We are one of the leading lubricant distribution company focused on distributing SINOPEC premium lubricants to transportation, industrial, commercial and marine customers in Cambodia market.

Our goal is to provide reliable customer service, product availability and effortless delivery options to match clients with the perfect lubricant for their needs by takes into consideration product run time, performance and price to offer the best oil value for customers, saving business time and money.

SINOPEC Premium Lubricants also meet the requirements of ISO, API and ACEA as well as various special specifications from OEMs.
